name: drupe
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of fruit that has a thin skin and a large stone (= a single seed with a hard cover) in the middle: The apricot is actually what is called a drupe or “stone fruit”.
More examplesFewer examplesPart II of the work deals with drupes (apricots, cherries, nectarines, peaches, plums).Pistachios are not true botanical nuts but drupes and what we call the nut is really the seed.Olive trees produce fruit which are drupes (fruits with a single seed).The olive, a drupe (the word comes from the Greek word for olive), can be picked at various stages of ripeness, turning green to black.
